claim.claim-text: 1. A refrigerator, comprising:one or more storage compartments, configured to store foods, wherein the foods are able to be identified by radio frequency identification (RFID) tags;one or more doors corresponding to the one or more storage compartments, provided at one or more openings for the one or more storage compartments;one or more RFID detection circuits in the one or more storage compartments, configured to detect signals from the RFID tags;one or more display panels on the one or more doors, configured to display an image and a user interface;a controller in communication with the one or more display panels, configured to:in response to that the one or more doors are all detected to be closed, obtain a first set of information, wherein the first set of information comprises identity information of each RFID tag in the one or more storage compartments;determine, by comparing the first set of information with a second set of information, one or more target tags placed in a first storage compartment of the one or more storage compartments, and determine one or more target placement times corresponding to the one or more target tags according to a current time of the refrigerator, wherein the second set of information is a set of information generated according to identity information of each RFID tag in the one or more storage compartments obtained in response to that the one or more doors are detected to be closed last time immediately before this closing of the one or more doors; anddisplay a first user interface comprising a freshness indicator of one or more foods identified by the one or more target tags, wherein the freshness indicator is generated according to the one or more target placement times corresponding to the one or more target tags.

2. The refrigerator according to claim 1, wherein the one or more target tags comprise a first target tag, and the first target tag is an RFID tag whose identity information merely exists in the first set of information and does not exist in the second set of information; anda target placement time corresponding to the first target tag is the current time of the refrigerator.

3. The refrigerator according to claim 1, wherein the one or more target tags comprise a second target tag, and the second target tag is an RFID tag whose identity information exists in the first set of information and the second set of information and is marked with a removed state in the second set of information.

4. The refrigerator according to claim 3, wherein the controller is further configured to:determine the current time as a target placement time corresponding to the second target tag in response to that a time difference between the current time and removal time corresponding to the second target tag is greater than a preset threshold;determine a last placement time corresponding to the second target tag as a target placement time corresponding to the second target tag in response to that a time difference between the current time and removal time corresponding to the second target tag is not greater than the preset threshold.

5. The refrigerator according to claim 1, wherein the one or more target tags comprise a third target tag, the third target tag is a third RFID tag whose identity information exists in the first set of information and the second set of information and is marked with a re-association state in the first set of information, and the re-association state indicates that food information currently associated with the third RFID tag is different from last associated food information immediately before this closing of the one or more doors.

6. The refrigerator according to claim 1, wherein the controller is further configured to:in response to an instruction for identifying an RFID tag from a user, obtain a tag code of a fourth RFID tag, wherein the tag code comprises a first code portion;determine whether the first code portion is a predetermined code;in response to the first code portion being the predetermined code, display a first association interface on the display panel, wherein the first association interface is configured to receive first food information for the fourth RFID tag input from the user; andupon receiving the first food information input from the user, associate the first food information with the fourth RFID tag, and store the first food information and fourth RFID tag in association.

7. The refrigerator according to claim 6, wherein the controller is further configured to:in response to the first code portion being not the predetermined code, obtain second food information for the fourth RFID tag according to the first code portion from a local memory;display a second association interface on the display panel, wherein the second food information is displayed on the second association interface, and the second association interface is configured to be not able to receive food information input from the user; andassociate the second food information with the fourth RFID tag.

8. The refrigerator according to claim 7, wherein the tag code of the fourth RFID tag further comprises a second code portion, and the controller is further configured to:associate the first food information or the second food information with the second code portion of the fourth RFID tag, and store the first food information or second food information and second code portion of the fourth RFID tag in association in the local memory.

9. The refrigerator according to claim 8, wherein the controller is further configured to:determine whether third food information associated with the fourth RFID tag exists in the local memory according to the second code portion;in response to the third food information associated with the fourth RFID tag existing in the local memory, pre-fill a preset input position on the first association interface with the third food information associated with the fourth RFID tag; andin response to the third food information associated with the fourth RFID tag not existing in the local memory, pre-fill the preset input position on the first association interface with a preset character.

10. A control method for a refrigerator, comprising:in response to that one or more doors corresponding to one or more storage compartments of the refrigerator are all detected to be closed, obtaining a first set of information, wherein the first set of information comprises identity information of each RFID tag in the one or more storage compartments, and the one or more doors is provided at one or more openings of the one or more storage compartments;by comparing the first set of information with a second set of information, determining one or more target tags placed in a first storage compartment of the one or more storage compartments, and determining one or more target placement times corresponding to the one or more target tags according to a current time of the refrigerator, wherein the second set of information is a set of information generated according to identity information of each RFID tag in the one or more storage compartments obtained in response to that the one or more doors are detected to be closed last time immediately before this closing of the one or more doors; anddisplaying a first user interface comprising a freshness indicator of one or more foods identified by the one or more target tags, wherein the freshness indicator is generated according to the one or more target placement times corresponding to the one or more target tags.

11. The control method according to claim 10, wherein the one or more target tags comprise a first target tag, and the first target tag is an RFID tag whose identity information merely exists in the first set of information and does not exist in the second set of information; anda target placement time corresponding to the first target tag is the current time.

12. The control method according to claim 10, wherein the one or more target tags comprise a second target tag, and the second target tag is an RFID tag whose identity information exists in the first set of information and the second set of information and is marked with a removed state in the second set of information.

13. The control method according to claim 10, further comprising:determining the current time as a target placement time corresponding to the second target tag in response to that a time difference between the current time and removal time corresponding to the second target tag is greater than a preset threshold;determining a last placement time corresponding to the second target tag as a target placement time corresponding to the second target tag in response to that a time difference between the current time and removal time corresponding to the second target tag is not greater than the preset threshold.

14. The control method according to claim 10, wherein the one or more target tags comprise a third target tag, the third target tag is a third RFID tag whose identity information exists in the first set of information and the second set of information and is marked with a re-association state in the first set of information, and the re-association state indicates that food information currently associated with the third RFID tag is different from last associated food information immediately before this closing of the one or more doors.

15. The control method according to claim 10, wherein further comprising:in response to an instruction for identifying an RFID tag from a user, obtaining a tag code of a fourth RFID tag, wherein the tag code comprises a first code portion;determining whether the first code portion is a predetermined code;in response to the first code portion being the predetermined code, display a first association interface on a display panel on the one or more doors, wherein the first association interface is configured to receive first food information for the fourth RFID tag input from the user; andupon receiving the first food information from the user, associating the first food information with the fourth RFID tag, and storing the first food information and fourth RFID tag in association.

16. The control method according to claim 15, wherein further comprising:in response to the first code portion being not the predetermined code, obtaining second food information for the fourth RFID tag according to the first code portion from a local memory;displaying a second association interface on the display panel, wherein the second food information is displayed on the second association interface, and the second association interface is configured to be not able to receive food information input from the user; andassociating the second food information with the fourth RFID tag.

17. The control method according to claim 15, wherein the tag code of the fourth RFID tag further comprises a second code portion, and the method further comprises:associating the first food information or the second food information with the second code portion of the fourth RFID tag, and storing the first food information or second food information and second code portion of the fourth RFID tag in association in the local memory.

18. The control method according to claim 17, further comprising:determining whether third food information associated with the fourth RFID tag exists in the local memory according to the second code portion;in response to that the third food information associated with the fourth RFID tag exists in the local memory, pre-fill a preset input position on the first association interface with the third food information; andin response to that food information associated with the fourth RFID tag does not exist in the local memory, pre-fill the preset input position on the first association interface with a preset character.
